results.title: Mystery of the Wax Museum
results.brief_description: Years after sculptor Ivan Igor’s partner burns down his wax museum and his “children”, Igor stars a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to direct lesser artists. People begin disappearing and Igor takes a sinister interested in his assistant’s fiancé.

constellations_other.name: Movies on wax
constellations_other.description: Waxing lyrical about the supernatural and early 21st-century teen stars.

results.description: Sculptor Ivan Igor struggles in vain to prevent his partner from burning his wax museum, and his “children”. Years later, Igor starts a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to directing lesser artists. People begin disappearing; Igor takes a sinister interest in Charlotte, fiancée of his assistant Ralph, but arouses the suspicions of roommate, wisecracking reporter Florence.
description_for_label: Sculptor Ivan Igor struggles in vain to prevent his partner from burning his wax museum, and his “children”. Years later, Igor starts a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to directing lesser artists. People begin disappearing; Igor takes a sinister interest in Charlotte, fiancée of his assistant Ralph, but arouses the suspicions of roommate, wisecracking reporter Florence.

results.title: Mystery men
results.creator_credit: Kinka Usher, Lloyd Levin, Mike Richardson, Lawrence Gordon, Dark Horse Entertainment, Golar and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the comic book series “The Dark Horse”, by Bob Burden, “Mystery men” is a twisted take on popular superhero films. In a futuristic city, crime has been all but erased by a vain superhero, Captain Amazing, who, with sponsors to placate, is in need of a supervillian to foil. Amazing’s alter ego paroles psychopath Casanova Frankenstein, jailed in an insane asylum for many years. When Amazing goes missing, it is up to the mystery men of the title to free him. The initial posse consists of Mr Furious (speciality is throwing tantrums), The Shoveller, and The Blue Raja, an expert at fork and spoon throwing. These three decide to expand their gang and recruit Spleen man (poisonous farts), The Bowler, Invisible Boy and The Sphinx who can shave metal with his mind. “Mystery men”, which had a reasonable budget and contains some impressive special effects, lost big money at the box office when it was released. Despite this the film successfully satirises the genre and is loaded with subversive humour that makes it an interesting comedy. The cast of great comedic talents includes Ben Stiller, Janeane Garafolo, Eddie Izzard, Hank Azaria and Paul Reubens.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kinka Usher, Lloyd Levin, Mike Richardson, Lawrence Gordon, Dark Horse Entertainment, Golar and Universal Pictures

results.title: Mystery island
results.brief_description: This adventure story involves a smuggling racket, a mysterious character and a ship wreck on a desert island - all set in the beautiful Northern Queensland reef islands! Two children visit their cousins who live on one of the islands and left to their own devices, the children get caught up in an intriguing series of events.

results.title: Mystery in the kitchen
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Why does a housewife concerned for her family’s welfare feed them so inadequately that she endangers their very lives? The film is a humorous and satirical attempt to remind the average housewife that it is not enough to be aware of modern food facts; they must also be applied in daily food purchasing and preparation. Cast includes Kay Tremblay Robert Berger, Norman Ettlinger, Mireille Goulet, Frank Heron. Written by Herb Hosie. Photographed by Reginald Morris. Edited by David Mayerovitch Music by Eldon Rathburn. Sound by Michael McKennirey.

results.title: Mystery at Fire Island
results.brief_description: It’s kids versus the criminals when the search for a missing friend uncovers an international plot! While vacationing on Fire Island, two young cousins risk danger to help find an old fisherman who has mysteriously disappeared. As the intrigue unfolds and the amateur sleuths find their way to solving the mystery we challenge you to do the same. Rated: G

results.title: Mystery at Castle House (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Spider, an adventurous 12 year old, takes his new friends, Ben and Kate, across the harbour to a deserted old mansion, Castle House. Two other boys disappear before their eyes in the overgrown grounds. The eccentric elderly owner suddenly returns, and Spider and his friends find a secret tunnel. Filmed around the natural bushland and bays of Sydney Harbour. it’s action all the way with enough crazy fun to keep children and their parents spellbound.

results.title: Mysterious object at noon
results.creator_credit: Apichatpong Weerasethakul, Mingmongkol Sonakul, Gridthiya Gaweewong, Firecracker Films, 6 Cinema Factory and 9/6 Cinema Factory
results.brief_description: Drawing on the Surrealist storytelling technique known as Exquisite Corpse, wherein a variety of writers would contribute to a story one sentence at a time, without knowing much about what the previous sentences contained “Mysterious object at noon” is a fragmented, open-ended anti-narrative. Thai independent filmmaker Apichatpong Weerasethakul used the technique to interview people throughout Thailand, learning a little bit about their lives and then asking them to contribute to the film’s evolving story. What emerges is at once a portrait of Thailand’s disenfranchised lower classes - farmers, fruit vendors, village performers of “mor lam” (a song-and-storytelling hybrid extremely popular in the rural northeast) - and a fractured group-narration of a story about a handicapped boy and his tutor, a woman named Dogfar. The finished story was then shot in dramatic form, using nonprofessional actors, and intercut with the earlier footage. An experimental mix of documentary and fiction, this highly unusual and unconventional work challenges defined notions of authorship, authenticity, genre cinema and narrative.

results.title: Mysterious Australia: The shaping of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
A journey through the puzzles that nature used as it designed and shaped the Australian continent. The story criss-crosses the continent discovering the world’s oldest living organisms and how sea fossils three hundred million years old came to be on a mountain top hundreds of kilometres from the ocean.

results.title: Mysteries of the ocean wanderers
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Parer-Cook, David Parer, BBC, National Geographic Society and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: The wandering albatross is the largest and most majestic of all sea birds, but until recently little was known about them. This program looks at the work of a team of French scientists on the Crozet Islands, south of South Africa, and their discoveries about this remarkable bird, as well as the teeming summer wildlife of the islands. Narrated by David Attenborough.

results.title: Myst (MAC)
results.brief_description: You are about to be drawn into an amazing alternative reality. ‘Myst’ is a game that was designed from the ground up to draw you in with little or no distractions on the screen to interfere with the feeling of being there. It is non-linear, with the most depth, detail and reality you’ve ever experienced in a game. The key to playing the game is to lose yourself in this fantastic virtual exploration, and act and react as if you were really there.
